body_html: Yes, the TensorProto> is used for serialized protos. The GetAttr is to just get some tensors of a given type. You can, however, pass the dtype to know which type you want, if that's useful. You can also pass dimensions separately. At this point, though, it might be better to use an input rather than an argument.
body_text: Yes, the TensorProto> is used for serialized protos. The GetAttr is to just get some tensors of a given type. You can, however, pass the dtype to know which type you want, if that's useful. You can also pass dimensions separately. At this point, though, it might be better to use an input rather than an argument.
body: Yes, the `TensorProto>` is used for serialized protos. The `GetAttr` is to just get some tensors of a given type. You can, however, pass the dtype to know which type you want, if that's useful. You can also pass dimensions separately. At this point, though, it might be better to use an input rather than an argument.
